thread.title: Daytona 500 results 2017: Kurt Busch wins NASCAR's biggest race of the season
thread.title_full: Daytona 500 results 2017: Kurt Busch wins NASCAR's biggest race of the season

author: Jordan Bianchi
title: Daytona 500 results 2017: Kurt Busch wins NASCAR's biggest race of the season
text:
Kurt Busch makes winning pass with two laps left to take the Daytona 500 victory. 
Kurt Busch survived a crash-plagued race to win Sunday’s Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway. Ryan Blaney finished second, followed by AJ Allmendinger, Aric Almirola and Paul Menard.
Busch passed Kyle Larson with two laps remaining to score his first victory in NASCAR”s biggest race. It was the first Daytona 500 win for the 2004 Cup Series champion and the first for car owner Tony Stewart, who retired after the 2016 season following an illustrious career but never having won the Daytona 500 in 17 attempts.
A succession of multi-car accidents just past halfway sent several contenders to the garage early, and changed the complexion of the race. 
The carnage began when Kyle Busch’s blown right-front tire sent him spinning into Matt Kenseth and Erik Jones, and left Dale Earnhardt Jr. with no path to avoid the trio. All four drivers retired and were released from the infield care center after undergoing a medical evaluation.
Thirteen laps after Busch’s tire sent him spinning, a 16-car accident further whittled down the field . This time the carnage started when Jamie McMurray turned defending Cup Series champion Jimmie Johnson entering Turn 3, blocking the track and causing the field to pileup. Sixteen cars were collected, including contenders Kevin Harvick and Brad Keselowski, who each continued.
